result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcelus Edward Goodwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Court ordered the defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 4/06/16. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge on COUNT 1 ONLY. Court WAIVED DNA surcharge on COUNT 2 as it is part of a continuous course of conduct.

Concurrent with: With COUNT 2; credit for 3 days time served. Defendant may have release for work, and may participate in vocational/educational programming. 
*Court ordered the defendant to report to the House of Correction by 9:00 a.m. on 10/09/15.

*Court ordered the defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 4/06/16. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge on COUNT 1 ONLY. Court WAIVED DNA surcharge on COUNT 2 as it is part of a continuous course of conduct.

Concurrent with: With COUNT 1; credit for 3 days time served. Defendant may have release for work, and may participate in vocational/educational programming. 
*Court ordered the defendant to report to the House of Correction by 9:00 a.m. on 10/09/15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcelus Edward Goodwin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcelus Edward Goodwin in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 24. Case set for sentencing hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. Statements made as to sentencing.

As to COUNT1-
Court ordered defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 2; credit for 3 days time served. Defendant may have release for work, and may participate in vocational/educational programming. 

As to COUNT2-
Court ordered defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 1; credit for 3 days time served. Defendant may have release for work, and may participate in vocational/educational programming. 

Court ordered the defendant to report to the House of Correction by 9:00 a.m. on 10/09/15.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 4/06/16. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge on COUNT 1 ONLY. Court WAIVED DNA surcharge on COUNT 2 as it is part of a continuous course of conduct. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Sentencing Referral Form;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Marcelus Edward Goodwin in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcelus Edward Goodwin in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcelus Edward Goodwin in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcelus Edward Goodwin in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Br. 24. Defense requests a continued Pretrial Conference. Due to branch 24 being down, case calendared off master calendar. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, or no drug paraphernalia.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  1 block radius of 2700 of W. Auer Avenue.

Defendant Marcelus Edward Goodwin in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/17/15 @ 1:30 pm
